H1.text: I know people who I would be happy to see fail

H2.text: I do not like most of my coworkers

H3.text: I enjoy making fun of my friends

H4.text: I have friendships that revolve around making fun of someone else

H6.text: I say or think mean things about other people

Y1.text: People come up to my desk to talk to me about non work related things

Y2.text: When I am bored, I go to other people’s desks to talk

Y3.text: I schedule hangouts with my friends to chat and catch up

Y4.text: I enjoy having multi-hour conversations with my friends about everything and nothing

Y5.text: I enjoy social gatherings and will jumpstart conversations

Y6.text: I enjoy a good recurring bit in my friend groups

B1.text: I do not go places other than work and my home

B2.text: I have few hobbies outside of work

B3.text: I do not seek out opportunities to do new things

B4.text: I do not like new experiences outside of my comfort zone

B5.text: I do not own a bedframe/chair/other essential piece of furniture

B6.text: I spend 4+ hours on my phone every day

S1.text: I enjoy at least one of the following sports: skiing/snowboarding, mountain biking, rock climbing.

S2.text: I do things that other people deem “too physically risky”

S3.text: I plan to climb a mountain in the next two years or have climbed a mountain in the past three years

S4.text: I have nontrivially injured myself doing a high-risk sport and will return/have returned to that sport

S5.text: I enjoy doing things that give me an adrenaline rush

S6.text: I have jumped off of something (cliff diving, bungee jumping, skydiving, etc.) over 50 feet high

G1.text: I will put in a lot of time and effort to become better at something

G2.text: I am either the first person in or the last person out of the office

G3.text: I spend more than 40 hours a week working

G4.text: I have spent at least a month working 60+ hours/week in the last two years

G5.text: Sunk cost fallacy does not exist for me—I will continue to work on something until it is finished

G6.text: I would voluntarily choose a job where I am working significantly more than 40 hours/week

C1.text: My laughter can be heard around the office

C2.text: I have a clown nickname that consists of ______ squeaks

C3.text: There are jokes made by me or about me

C5.text: I have been emojied in Starfish google chat

C6.text: I am a happy person and make the people around me happy too

W1.text: I get sidetracked while in the middle of working on a task

W2.text: It is very easy to start me on a long conversational tangent

W3.text: I have many unfinished projects and side hobbies

W4.text: I am easily distracted by noise or conversations around me

W5.text: I fidget when I am sitting for a long time

W6.text: It is difficult for me to start a task that requires a lot of organization/documentation

O1.text: I am detail oriented and take joy in organizing my work and life

O2.text: I become upset when things are not in their proper place

O3.text: I have a weekly routine that I do not like to deviate from

O4.text: Chaos or disorganization in any area of my life stresses me out

O5.text: I am on time to things

O6.text: I enjoy optimizing and documenting my life and daily routines
